description: From Middle English chamelet, chamelot, chamlot via Old French chamelot, suffixed  +‎ -ot from Arabic خَمْلَة‎ (ḵamla, “velvet”).

adjectives.description: camlet (comparative more camlet, superlative most camlet)

examples: This morning came home my fine Camlett cloak, with gold buttons, and a silk suit, which cost me much money, and I pray God to make me able to pay for it.

entries.meaning: A fine fabric made from wool (originally camel, but later goat) and silk.
examples: She was richly clad in a bodice of gold-coloured camlet and a skirt of gray silk trimmed with gold and silver lace.
